title: Frances Lin
text:
I am a PhD candidate in Statistics at Oregon State University. I am currently a Software Engineer Intern at Posit PBC (formerly RStudio Inc.).
Outside of work, I enjoy skiing, traveling, being outdoors, and watching thriller or dark comedy films and series on Netflix.

title: Hello, world!
text: Welcome to my new site, built with Quarto by Posit PBC. I’m currently in the process of migrating content from my previous site, so stay tuned!

title: Experience
text:
Oregon State University

PhD Student Researcher
Sep 2021 - Present


Statistics and ML Consultant
Jan 2021 - Mar 2025
• Provided consulting services across diverse fields, collaborating with faculty members, junior statisticians, and client researchers to support multiple PhD and master’s-level research initiatives.  • Effectively communicated statistical concepts to non-statistical clients and delivered in-depth reports on topics including simple statistical tests, advanced data modeling, application software (R, Python), experimental design, and data processing and visualization.


Graduate Teaching Assistant
Mar 2020 - Present
• Assist with graduate and undergraduate courses such as machine learning III, missing data and causal inference, spatial statistics, stochastic models, computational statistics, data analysis methods I (hypothesis testing, multiple testing), II (regression analysis, model selection), III (dimension reduction techniques, generalized regression models), mathematical statistics I, II, statistical methods, statistics for engineers, and elementary statistics I.  • Teach R programming and discuss statistical problems during labs or recitations, hold office hours, and grade exams and assignments.


Graduate Project Assistant
Jun 2024 - Aug 2024
• Assisted with the design and development of the course curriculum for spatial statistics.  • Applied a variety of spatial models, including kriging / Gaussian process regression, C / SAR (conditional / simultaneous autoregressive), and Poisson process / CSR models for simulation and applications such as housing price prediction, disease risk mapping, and forest and forest fire modeling.
